articles.author: Suleiman Al-Khalidi, Maya Gebeily
articles.description: Hundreds of fighters from Iran-backed Iraqi militias crossed into Syria overnight to help the government fight rebels who seized Aleppo last week, Syrian and Iraqi sources said on Monday, and Tehran pledged to aid the Damascus government.
articles.title: Iraqi militias enter Syria to reinforce government forces, military sources say

articles.author: Maya Gebeily, Adam Makary
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it struck dozens of targets throughout Lebanon, shortly after Hezbollah accused Israel of violating a ceasefire agreement and fired missiles on an Israeli military position in the disputed Shebaa Farms area.
articles.title: Israel strikes Lebanon after Hezbollah attack as ceasefire violations mount

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: An overnight Russia drone attack has left Ukraine's western city of Ternopil without electricity, a regional military official said on Tuesday, a week after Moscow's strikes cut power to much of the city and its surrounding region.
articles.title: Russian drone attack leaves parts of Ukraine's Ternopil without power, military says

articles.author: Ben Blanchard, Yimou Lee
articles.description: Taiwan's defence ministry said on Tuesday it is watching the movements of a Chinese aircraft carrier and assessing China's military activities as security sources said Beijing could launch new war games as soon as this weekend.
articles.title: Taiwan watching Chinese carrier movements as sources say war games may start this weekend

articles.author: Elizabeth Pineau, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Prime Minister Michel Barnier dropped planned cuts to medication reimbursements in a last-minute bid to get his 2025 budget bill over the line.
articles.title: France's Barnier makes last-minute concession to far right in bid to avoid being toppled

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's President Vladimir Putin and his Belarusian counterpart, Alexander Lukashenko, will sign a landmark security pact on Friday that reflects global geopolitical changes, Russian state news agency RIA said on Tuesday.
articles.title: Russia, Belarus to sign landmark security pact, Russian news agency says

articles.author: Mandy Leong, Hasnoor Hussain
articles.description: Residents in the Malaysian town of Tumpat were returning to submerged homes and shops as deadly floodwaters eased in some areas following the worst floods in decades over the weekend, and more heavy rain was forecast as soon as Tuesday.
articles.title: Malaysians return to devastated homes as floodwaters recede; more rain expected

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of migrants reaching Spain's Canary Islands on precarious vessels from West Africa has hit an all-time annual record with 41,425 arrivals between Jan. 1 and Nov. 30 of this year, Interior Ministry data showed on Monday.
articles.title: Number of migrants reaching Spain's Canary Islands breaks all-time record

articles.author: Trevor Hunnicutt, Catarina Demony
articles.description: Joe Biden will use his visit to Angola on Tuesday, the first by a U.S. president to the sub-Saharan African country, to mark the two nations' shared history in the transatlantic slave trade.
articles.title: Biden to mark US and Angola's shared slave trade history

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. President-elect Donald Trump on Monday said he will travel to Paris on Saturday to attend the reopening of the Notre-Dame Cathedral, which was gutted by fire over five years ago, in his first foreign trip since winning the election.
articles.title: Trump to attend Notre-Dame Cathedral reopening in first foreign trip since election
